bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Configuration files shouldn't be under /usr.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): texlive-kpathsea-svn37193.0-24.fc24.1.noarch
How reproducible: Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Erase
Actual results: warning: /usr/share/texlive/texmf-dist/web2c/fmtutil.cnf saved as /usr/share/texlive/texmf-dist/web2c/fmtutil.cnf.rpmsave
Expected results: No warnings
Additional info:
You're not wrong, but I don't think we can untangle texlive to make it understand that some files are in /etc.
Ok. Just a thought: how about moving the files under /etc and symlinking to them from /usr? This way /usr can be readonly and shared.
